main event: On May 19, 1949, at Fort Bliss, Texas, a military ground visual observation reported a single flashing silver object resembling a round, thin disc.
interesting points: The object was the apparent size of a thumbnail at arm's length and was observed at an altitude of 30 degrees, slowly descending in the direction of approximately 100 degrees.
Observers estimated the speed of the object to be 15-20 miles in 5 minutes (150 - 240 mph) and noted its irregular rolling and tilting motion as it moved away.
No sound or odor was reported, and no physical evidence or trail was left by the object.
The observation lasted approximately 5 minutes under bright sunshine with no clouds and was witnessed by multiple credible military personnel.
There were no photographs or additional physical evidence related to the sighting.
sighted object: Single flashing silver object resembling a round, thin disc
witnesses: Credible military personnel from D Btry, 39th Bn
